scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Regina Ross
scrape.text: I specifically chose to read "The Dinner" because it's so polarizing, kind of as an experiment to see what a book with a low GR rating is like. Turns out I didn't find it to be dreadful. There are some great nuances and observations about the human psyche that I enjoyed. But ultimately it's a frustrating story, with way more than its share of ambiguities and unanswered questions. If you prefer things to be black and white, this isn't the book for you.
